title: Where to Get Vaccinated
cleaned_text: Prevention and Control Division 651-201-5414 Contact Info Infectious Disease Epidemiology, Prevention and Control Division 651-201-5414 Last Updated: 11/22/2022 Where to Get Vaccinated Start with your medical home - a place you regularly receive health care. If your medical home is unable to vaccinate you, other options include: - Local Health Department or Community Health Board - Pharmacy - Retail locations [Vaccination Clinics Serving Uninsured and Underinsured Adults](/people/immunize/basics/uuavsearch.html) Search by county for clinics with free vaccine for qualifying uninsured and underinsured adults. [Free or Low-Cost Shots for Children](/people/immunize/basics/howpay.html) The Minnesota Vaccines for Children Program (MnVFC) offers free or low cost shots for children 18 years of age and younger. See this screening form to find out if your child is eligible and check with your clinic to see if they participate in the MnVFC program. [Vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/) Search by ZIP code for locations offering flu and COVID-19 vaccine near you.
